title: Flint police looking for suspect in shooting death of 12-year-old boy
content:
FLINT, MI -- Police are seeking a male suspect in connection with the accidental shooting death Friday, March 13 of a 12-year-old boy in Flint.
(UPDATE: Flint police say no suspects in connection with 12-year-old boy's shooting death)
Officers responded around 6:15 p.m. Friday to the 1800 block of Barks Street in reference to an accidental shooting and discovered the boy with a single gunshot wound.
He was taken via ambulance to Hurley Medical Center's Emergency and pronounced dead on arrival. Investigators arrived on the scene and the investigation continues.
The suspect, whose name is not being released by The Flint Journal because no arrest has been made and no charges filed, was identified by police in a press release.
Genesee County Prosecutor David Leyton said the incident remains under investigation, but could not provide any further comment.
Flint Police Chief James Tolbert could not be immediately reached for comment Sunday morning on why the person is being called a suspect.
Anyone with information regarding the shooting incident may contact Flint police Detective Sgt. Ronald Dixon at 810-237-6905 or contact Crime Stoppers at 1-800-SPEAK-UP (773-2587).
